net.jawr.web.resource.bundle.renderer

Interface BundleRenderer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CssBundleLinkRenderer, JsBundleLinkRenderer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBundleLinkRenderer, CSSHTMLBundleLinkRenderer, JavascriptHTMLBundleLinkRenderer

    public interface BundleRenderer
extends Serializable
    This interface defines operations to generate import tags for bundled resources.
    Author:
    Jordi Hernández Sellés, ibrahim Chaehoi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String GZIP_PATH_PREFIX
      Prefix to append to every URL that points to a gzipped version of a resource.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ResourceBundlesHandler getBundler() 
      String getResourceType()
      Returns the resource type
      void renderBundleLinks(String requestedPath, BundleRendererContext ctx, Writer out)
      Render a link to the specified resource.

    • Field Detail

      • GZIP_PATH_PREFIX

        static final String GZIP_PATH_PREFIX
        Prefix to append to every URL that points to a gzipped version of a resource.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • renderBundleLinks

        void renderBundleLinks(String requestedPath,
                     BundleRendererContext ctx,
                     Writer out)
                       throws IOException
        Render a link to the specified resource.
        Parameters:
        requestedPath - String Path that identifies a resource bundle id or one of its members.
        ctx - the bundle renderer context
        out - Writer Writer to output the tags, typically a JSPWriter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO exception occurs

      • getBundler

        ResourceBundlesHandler getBundler()
        Returns:
        ResourceBundlesHandler The resources handler used by this renderer.

      • getResourceType

        String getResourceType()
        Returns the resource type
        Returns:
        the resource type
